alert.note: Alert for Bell (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued April 12 at 8:18PM CDT until April 12 at 9:45PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR CENTRAL BELL COUNTY... At 818 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms that produced heavy rain across central Bell county. The storms have moved east of the region, but between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen this evening. This amount of rainfall is enough to cause flash flooding. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets, and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Killeen, Temple, Copperas Cove, Harker Heights, Belton, Fort Hood, Nolanville, Morgan`s Point Resort, Salado, Little River-Academy and Troy. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
